Ok, a long shot, there are other libraries with @Test annotations, could it=

be that simply the wrong @Test annotation is imported?

That would the kin=
d of thing that could bite me with some unattentive import
completion. (The=
 imports are usually folded in eclipse).

I have never experienced any debu=
gger issues myself with eclipse so it
doesn't seem highly likely (though I =
don't uses the debugger much). I also
believe that the tests are never run =
for some reason. Put some sysouts in
the tests just to make sure they are a=
ctually run and then take it from
there is what I would do.

/J

d

 am running Eclipse Java EE IDE for Web Developers. Version: Helios

ce Release 1 Build id: 20100917-0705.

ethods in a JUnit4 test, e.g. in

and when I debug the test, only the

uggested using JVM option -XX:+UseParallelGC but neither one worked

e.

ons on how to resolve this problem?
